New Records: Moeen Ali scored his fastest half-century in T20 internationals.
Key Match Events: Moeen Ali hit a quickfire 63 off 28 balls.
Moeen Ali's assault on Jason Holder over was instrumental in reaching a competitive total.
Moeen Ali dismissed both West Indies openers in successive overs.
Nicholas Pooran hit West Indies' first boundary in 42 balls in the 14th over.
Chris Jordan and Reece Topley finished the job for England's seamers.
Pre-Game Insights: Moeen Ali blamed England’s defeat in the third match on having to bowl eight overs of heavily punished spin.
Post-Match Reflections: Moeen Ali expressed happiness in contributing to keeping the series alive.
Moeen Ali reflected on his performance, contrasting it with his previous game where he got out for a duck and bowled an expensive over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Kensington Oval.
England won by 34 runs to level the series and set up a decider on Sunday night.
